poem:
**Venetian Vows**

In the ripple of the Grand Canal,  
stars twinkle alongside protests,  
where a super yacht—like a misplaced cloud—  
floats, dispensing foam like confetti  
on ancient waters.  
Beneath Venetian skies,  
lavish vows echo,  
as love and wealth  
glide through canals,  
ballasting the city  
with ephemeral promises  
and headlines that bob  
and vanish with the tide.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jeff in Venice: seven takeaways from the Bezos-Sánchez wedding Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and journalist Lauren Sánchez held their wedding ceremony in Venice’s Grand canal on Friday, the centrepiece of a three-day gala that drew dozens of stars but also protests by local activists. Here are seven takeaways. Foam party The couple kicked off celebrations with a foam party on their $500m (£364m) super yacht moored near the Croatian island of Unije. Coinciding with Sánchez’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
